snippet: Derrick Rose, who tore an anterior cruciate ligament in Game 1, could only watch as Philadelphia romped against Chicago, which was outscored, 62-37, in the second half.
abstract: NBA Roundup; Philadelphia 76ers defeat Chicago Bulls, 109-92, to even the Eastern Conference first-round playoff series, 1-1; other NBA news noted. Photo (M)

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and HOWARD BECK

lead_paragraph: CHICAGO -- Derrick Rose limped to center court to deliver the game ball before Game 2 between the Chicago Bulls and the Philadelphia 76ers on Tuesday night. Rose, the N.B.A.'s reigning most valuable player, forced a smile, waved to the crowd, and then retired to a suite where he watched the 76ers' 109-92 win that evened the Eastern Conference first-round series at 1-1. Rose, who wore a brace on his left leg because of a torn anterior cruciate ligament he sustained in Game 1, got a standing ovation from fans and players on both benches, as the crowd chanted, ''M.V.P.''

headline.main: Playing Without Rose, Bulls Lose to 76ers and Series Is Tied
